text: @BlindWaveProd Hey, I just saw this. Many podcasts have used those questions, but I feel like this was the best I've ever seen it done (esp. the "gay conman Jesus" concept).
"The farmer did not dry clean the sheep." https://t.co/JDFcoSZw2y
I can’t believe we’re actually discussing this.
https://t.co/0n0OpvRRAn
Two events: Next Thursday (April 5), I will be interviewing Rex Sorgatz about his book (THE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF MISINFORMATION) at the Powell's in Beaverton. Details here: https://t.co/8XjCNMggWV  [1]

Then on April 19 (also a Thursday), I will be interviewing Sloane Crosley about her new essay collection (LOOK ALIVE OUT THERE) at the Powell's in downtown PDX. Details here: https://t.co/dhAnLvwnzQ  [ 2 ]
A black computer bag containing a Mac laptop has been lost on the MAX red line train, headed toward the PDX airport. If this item is located, please contact this account. There is a reward.
Computer has been located. Also, it wasn’t mine. But I appreciate the concern.
Just a reminder. Again, this is at the Cedar Hills Crossing location. https://t.co/3T6lfIVeke

My latest book (which is an anthology of journalism and essays from the past 12 years) will be released in softcover on May 1. If you buy it, I will come to your house and wash your car. https://t.co/u9EVHjJ49Q

PEOPLE OF SEATTLE: I'm doing an event in your town this Saturday. It's at the University Book Store at 5:30 pm (kind of an odd time, I realize, but convenient for those who intend to get blasted later that night). The Q & A will be lively. Details here: https://t.co/E5hY3NtGIu

I will be at Powell's Bookstore (here in Portland) next Monday at 7:30 pm (May 14). In order to accentuate the event's "local eccentricity," I will perform the reading while assembling a ship inside a glass bottle. https://t.co/afmnoBWYnb
This is impressive. https://t.co/inzNIfPh2i
I can confirm the accuracy of this tweet. https://t.co/qFMmvLPD8k

I'll be reading at Booksmith in SF on Thursday at 7 pm. I realize this is not ideal timing for NBA fans, but the Warriors will probably be up 3-1, anyway. Also, there will likely be more open chairs and a high temp of only 61, no hopefully no one will faint his time. https://t.co/te8GybnN0j
I’ll be speaking at Skylight Books in LA at 7:30 pm this Friday. Skeletons welcome. https://t.co/4Fv3tVfeTI
Straightforward. https://t.co/1bBLJwrUl5
https://t.co/uFiblhzIpC

So this is a bit curious: I'm doing a reading (and being interviewed) in north Portland, in some random woman's living room, reading excerpts from a new book I won't release until 2019. Space is limited (25 seats). Info here: https://t.co/wN6crrpREZ
Thanks to @LaneBrown  on this, the Eddie Van Halen of editing jokes about Eddie Van Halen https://t.co/Czn1lJ5wKZ
